oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Royal Crown Cola - 1947-11-08 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of excerpts from a Royal Crown Cola sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment (9:00-9:30 pm) from November 8, 1947. Featuring Louie Buck (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, and Tommy Jackson. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Followed by a performance by Curly Fox, likely from a different Opry segment (unconfirmed).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tommy Jackson; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Curly Fox
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: [Unidentified fiddle tune] (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- [break] -- Theme (Turkey In The Straw, RCC version) -- Closing statement (Louie Buck) (incomplete) -- [break] -- Johnson's Old Grey Mule (Curly Fox)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Bashful Brother Oswald; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Wilson, Lonnie; Zinkan, Joe; Jackson, Tommy; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Fox, Curly;
